rationales.stimulation: Nabil stayed at the office during the holiday weekend for a deployment window instead of taking time off, choosing the predictable and controlled over any novelty or change of pace.
rationales.self_direction: His nudge response reveals he stays not out of autonomous choice but because he feels others' perception — that seventeen years in one place means he had no other options — defines him, surrendering self-definition to external judgment.
rationales.conformity: He stayed for the deployment because 'someone needed to be there,' fulfilling the dutiful role expected of the senior engineer rather than delegating to the junior as Rima suggested.
rationales.security: Nabil takes comfort in knowing 'every hallway, every server room, every shortcut in the build system,' valuing the deep familiarity and stability of seventeen years at the same company.

rationales.power: Nabil sat through the restructuring meeting asking no questions, accepting a subordinate position where management decides his fate while he calculates survival months in the parking lot.
rationales.self_direction: He chose to ask nothing in the meeting, deferring entirely to management's framing, and his nudge response confirms this was strategic avoidance: 'you don't ask those things in front of everyone.'
rationales.conformity: He sat nodding and taking notes during the restructuring meeting, deliberately suppressing his questions to avoid making himself 'a target,' following the unspoken rule of not challenging leadership publicly.
rationales.security: After the meeting he immediately checked the bank app and savings, doing the mental math on how many months his family could survive, revealing his core concern for financial safety.

rationales.achievement: Nabil finished the API migration ahead of schedule, demonstrating professional competence and exceeding the expected standard.
rationales.benevolence: He had lunch with his colleague Marwan and found reassurance in the connection, maintaining a close workplace relationship during a stressful period.
rationales.tradition: Nabil started cleaning the guest room for Rima's mother's visit and told his daughters they need to be 'presentable,' upholding family customs and expectations around hosting elders.
rationales.conformity: He instructed his daughters to be presentable for their grandmother's visit, enforcing social etiquette and family expectations even when they complained.

rationales.power: Nabil smiled and poured more coffee when his mother-in-law compared him unfavorably to Fadi, absorbing the status slight without defending himself or asserting his own worth.
rationales.self_direction: He suppressed his honest reaction to his mother-in-law's criticism, internally fuming about keeping her daughter's life stable but saying nothing, letting others define his narrative.
rationales.tradition: Despite his frustration, Nabil served his mother-in-law coffee and maintained the expected deference to an elder family member, honoring the hosting tradition.
rationales.conformity: He smiled and changed the subject rather than responding to his mother-in-law's provocative comment, restraining himself to preserve family harmony during the visit.
rationales.security: His internal defense — 'I'm keeping her daughter's life stable' — reveals that his identity and self-worth are built around providing financial and domestic stability for his family.

rationales.stimulation: Nabil looked at the Dubai startup opportunity for fifteen minutes then closed the tab, choosing to stay with the familiar rather than pursue the novel, higher-paying role.
rationales.self_direction: He closed the tab on the recruiter's offer without engaging, unable to make an autonomous choice to even explore the opportunity, paralyzed between his father's advice and Rima's likely encouragement.
rationales.security: He rejected the Dubai fintech startup specifically because it was a two-year contract 'with no guarantees after that,' fixating on what happens 'if I jump and there's nothing underneath.'

rationales.achievement: Nabil shipped the authentication module and received client approval, demonstrating professional competence recognized by an external party.
rationales.hedonism: He took his daughters out for ice cream after work, enjoying a spontaneous moment of family pleasure to celebrate the relief.
rationales.benevolence: He treated his daughters to ice cream as a way of sharing his good news, turning his personal relief into a family moment of connection.
rationales.security: The restructuring email confirmed his department is safe, and his description of relief as 'unclenching' after weeks of tight-jawed anxiety shows how much the threat to stability consumed him.

rationales.power: Nabil's manager told him 'that's why I need you in the room,' which he interpreted as being valued only as 'the brakes on everyone else's engine,' a subordinate role that dampens rather than leads.
rationales.achievement: He identified fifteen ways Sara's platform rewrite would break existing integrations and later gave his manager a realistic eighteen-month timeline, demonstrating deep technical expertise.
rationales.stimulation: He sat through a presentation about 'innovation culture' and 'embracing disruption' and internally resisted it, choosing to protect existing systems rather than engage with the new framework proposal.
rationales.self_direction: Nabil kept his mouth shut during the breakout session rather than voicing his expert assessment, letting the room's enthusiasm override his professional judgment.
rationales.conformity: He clapped when everyone else clapped during the VP's presentation and avoided being 'the old guy who kills momentum,' restraining his critical assessment to maintain group harmony.
rationales.security: His core concern was protecting existing client integrations and system stability, warning his manager about losing two major clients during a transition — prioritizing the known over the disruptive.

rationales.achievement: Nabil received 'exceeds expectations' across the board and was called 'the backbone of the engineering team,' confirming his professional competence through formal recognition.
rationales.stimulation: His nudge response reveals he might want to be seen as someone who 'pushed for something risky,' but immediately qualifies 'that's not me,' actively choosing the predictable identity over novelty.
rationales.conformity: He was praised as 'a stabilizing presence during periods of change,' and while ambivalent about this label, he accepts it as his defined role within the organization.
rationales.security: The annual review confirms his position as the reliable, stable anchor of the team, and Rima's unsurprised 'of course' reinforces that his identity is built around dependable consistency.

rationales.hedonism: Nabil chose the scenic coast road instead of the highway on the drive home, savoring the pleasant experience while Rima slept beside him — a small but deliberate choice of enjoyment.
rationales.benevolence: He took the girls to visit their grandmother on Saturday, investing family time in maintaining the close intergenerational relationship.
rationales.tradition: The visit to Rima's mother and the family drive together reflect maintenance of family customs and regular connection with elders.
